paragraph.string: Statin Use in Persons with Diabetes (SUPD) is a Medicare Star Measure. We have reviewed our records and noticed that the patient below is currently not on a statin medication. As you know, it is recommended for patients with diabetes aged 40-75 years without atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) to be started on a moderate-intensity statin for primary prevention. For secondary prevention, patients of all ages with diabetes and ASCVD are recommended to be on a high-intensity statin.

Action Requested:
Please review the information provided. Indicate the appropriate action items and fax us the form at {hotline_fax}.

items: Patient is a candidate for statin therapy; I will send a new statin prescription to the patient’s preferred pharmacy:
I will discuss statin therapy during the patient’s next appointment on ______________ (date)
Patient has refused statin therapy in the past

Patient is already on a statin. Please indicate what statin the patient is currently on below:

_________________________________________________
Patient is pregnant, lactating, undergoing In vitro fertilization (IVF), or is using Clomiphene

Patient is not appropriate for statin therapy at this time due to meeting one or more of the following exclusion criteria. Please select all that apply and submit a non-chargeable claim code using the appropriate ICD-10 codes. Codes must be updated each measure year to ensure your patient is appropriately excluded.

table_items.string: □  Alcoholic cirrhosis of liver without ascites

paragraph.string: H- Hydrophilic L -Lipophilic; if myalgia occurs on a lipophilic statin despite dose reductions, it may be prudent to attempt a trial of a hydrophilic statin.
We appreciate working with you to provide high-quality healthcare for our patients.

This communication contains confidential and protected health information. It is intended only for the use of the addressee. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately and destroy all copies.
